benchmark_details.name: Synthetic Datasets for Knowledge Graph Completion Evaluation
benchmark_details.overview: Proposes synthetic datasets to evaluate the inference ability of pre-trained language model-based knowledge graph completion (KGC) methods by separately considering pre-trained knowledge and inference capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the inference capabilities of PLM-based knowledge graph completion methods by constructing synthetic datasets.

data.size: Multiple datasets with varying sizes (e.g., 40,943 entities, 86,835 training triples for WN18RR)
data.annotation: Synthetic data generation methods described in the paper.

methods: Evaluation of KGC methods using synthetic datasets
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the rank prediction metrics such as Hits@k, mean rank (MR), and mean reciprocal rank (MRR).
methodology.interpretation: Higher Hits@k values indicate better performance in inferring unseen links.
methodology.baseline_results: TransE performance for comparison, specific scores not provided.
methodology.validation: Results validated through experiments on different pre-trained models.
